content:
It's great that you want to show interest in your partner's hobbies! Here are some tips on how to do so without pretending to be someone you're not:

1. Ask questions: Ask your partner about the rules or history of the sport/hobby they enjoy. Ask them what they like about it and listen attentively to what they have to say.

2. Attend events: Attend a game or event with your partner to show your support and enjoy the experience together. You can even make it a fun outing with friends and other couples.

3. Share your interests: Share your own interests and passions with your partner. Show them that you appreciate and value the unique things that you both bring into the relationship.

4. Find common ground: Look for a common ground where both of your interests overlap. You can try other sports or activities that involve some elements of your common interests.

5. Be yourself: Don’t try to be someone you're not. If you're not into sports, it's okay to admit that to your partner. Focus on showing your support and being present in the moment.

Remember, it's important to be honest and open in the relationship. You can still show interest and support in your partner's hobbies without pretending to enjoy them yourself. By doing so, you can learn more about your partner and discover new things about each other.
